sections.name: Fintech in Math: Simple Interest and Budgeting (UAE Context)
sections.math_objective: Students will model simple interest, discounts, and budgeting scenarios using percentages and decimals; interpret outcomes to inform decisions.

materials: scenario cards tailored to UAE contexts

success_criteria.metric: Accuracy of simple interest calculation (I = P × r × t)
Ability to compare total costs after discounts/fees in two fintech scenarios
Clear group reasoning with justification statements

teacher.objective: Lead a 30-minute mini-lesson introducing fintech concepts relevant to UAE Grade 6-8 math, focusing on simple interest, discounts, and budgeting; connect to everyday UAE examples (students budgeting for school trip, wallet balance, etc.).
steps: Show UAE-relevant real-world scenario cards (e.g., budgeting for a school event and wallet balance).
Guide students through I = P × r × t calculation and A = P + I using AED currency in annual terms.
Have students compare two options with fees/charges and justify the more cost-effective choice in UAE context.

shared.objective: In small group, compare two fintech scenarios (e.g., wallet top-up with fees vs. promotional offer) and decide which yields lower total cost; justify using calculations and UAE context.
steps: Read two scenarios and identify data needed for calculations.
Work collaboratively to compute results and decide which option is cheaper; prepare a brief justification.

1.objective: Student 1 will calculate simple interest for given P, r, t and explain the steps aloud.
steps: Identify P, r, t from the scenario card.
Compute I = P × r × t and A = P + I; articulate steps aloud.

2.objective: Student 2 will analyze budgeting scenario including discounts and fees; compute final amount and justify the choice.
steps: Set up numbers from the budgeting scenario.
Compute total cost including discounts/fees; compare options and justify selection.
